trigger.name: Zabbix Agent Ping
trigger.description: Zabbix agent does not respond to a ping request in the last two calls or no information about agent-status is received in the last 30 minutes.

trigger.name: Zabbix Agent Ping no data for {$MONITOR_TIMEOUT} seconds
trigger.description: No measurement information about agent-status is received in the last {$MONITOR_TIMEOUT} seconds

item.name: Zabbix Agent Release
item.description: The release of the zabbix agent

item.name: Number of process threads
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

trigger.name: ICMP Ping failed 3 times
trigger.description: Host is not reachable by a icmp-echo request for the last three measures or not measurement data arrived in the last 900 seconds(15min).

dependency.name: ICMP Ping no data for {$MONITOR_TIMEOUT} seconds

trigger.name: ICMP Ping no data for {$MONITOR_TIMEOUT} seconds
trigger.description: Host is not reachable by a icmp-echo request for the last three measures or not measurement.

item.name: Number of maximum open file descriptors
Maximum number of processes
item.description: Total number of possible processes.

item.name: Linux Kernel Dmesg Health
item.description: Reads the output of dmesg and discovers kernel problems.

trigger.name: OS Kernel - {ITEM.VALUE1}
trigger.description:
A kernel problem occurred. Review dmesg with the timestamps listed in the item.
This trigger does not recover automatically, to get rid of this trigger, you have to use the "Close problem"

trigger.name: Check Multipath Maps Status
trigger.description:
Check if there are failed fiberchannel paths. Check zabbix_agent log, dmesg or "multipath -ll" to verify. Status "ERROR" is reported if one or more paths are not ok.
example output: "OK: L:6,P:15,B0" "ERROR: L:6,P:15,B2"
L: Number of LUNS P: Number of paths B: Number of failed paths

item.name: MTA Queue Total number of frozen messages
MTA Queue Total number of messages
NFS RPC Calls
item.description: RPC operations per second

item.name: NFS RPC Retransmits
item.description: RPC retransmits in the last two minutes

item.name: NTP good peer count
item.description:
Number of good ntp peer servers (should be at least 3 severs).
A man with one watch knows what time it is. A man with two watches is never sure.

item.name: NTP Primary Peer Delay
item.description: Round trip communication delay to the remote peer or server (milliseconds)

item.name: NTP Primary Peer RMS Jitter
item.description: Mean deviation (jitter) in the time reported for that remote peer or server (RMS of difference of multiple time samples, milliseconds)

item.name: NTP Primary Peer RMS Offset
item.description: Mean offset (phase) in the times reported between this local host and the remote peer or server (RMS, milliseconds)

trigger.name: NTP Absolute RMS Time Offset > {$MAX_NTP_OFFSET_MS} ms
trigger.description: Time difference between the host and the active ntp peer is greater than {$MAX_NTP_OFFSET}

dependency.name: NTP Absolute Time RMS Offset no data

trigger.name: Memory consumption {ITEM.VALUE1} > {$MEMORY_USERSPACE_USAGE_LIMIT} %
trigger.description: Memory usage should exceeded {$MEMORY_USERSPACE_USAGE_LIMIT}. If memory usage of userspace processes is too high, this typically leads to bad application performance because no filesystem cache is available.

item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Number of zombie processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Cron Daemon
item.description: Ubuntu,Debian, ...

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

trigger.name: CPU Usage IO Wait > {$IOWAIT_ALERT_LIMIT}% = {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}
trigger.description: The average of a one hour iowait cpu time is higher than 20%

trigger.name: CPU Steal Time > {$STEAL_TIME_ALERT_LIMIT}% = {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}
trigger.description: The average of a one hour iowait cpu time is higher than 20%

item.name: Swap In Pages
item.description: Pages moved from SWAP to Memory

item.name: Swap Out Pages
item.description: Pages moved from Memory to SWAP

trigger.name: Swap usage > 60%
trigger.description: System is in 90% swap. Memory usage is higher than available physical memory.

trigger.name: Swap usage > {$SWAP_NOTIFY_LIMIT}% = {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}%
trigger.description: System is over {$SWAP_NOTIFY_LIMIT}% swap usage. Memory usage is higher than available physical memory.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: Reboot Required
item.description: Indicates if a restart is required after system updates.

trigger.name: Reboot required
trigger.description:
This trigger fires if a reboot is required after a system uddate.
Rebooting the system is a good idea, bcause this improves security and fixes bug in installed components which cannot be reloaded by a service restart. (livbc-updates, kernel, ...)
Remove the flagfile if you decide that no reboot is required (/var/run/reboot-required).

item.name: Number of current open file descriptors
MD Raid Inconsistent Devices
item.description:
There are inconsistent devices.
This looks like this:
md1 : active raid1 sdb2[2] sda2[0] 195310144 blocks [2/1] [U_] [=>...................] recovery = 8.5% (16775552/195310144) finish=17.0min speed=259783K/sec

item.name: Zabbix Agent Extension Release
item.description: The release of the zabbix agent extensions

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME} errors : {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}/{ITEM.LASTVALUE2} (in/out)
trigger_prototype.description: There are interface errors, check your network equipment

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME} errors : {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}/{ITEM.LASTVALUE2} (in/out)
trigger_prototype.description: There are interface errors, check your network equipment

trigger_prototype.name: Blockdevice {#BLOCKDEVICE} write limit {$DISK_HIGH_WRITE_IOPS_LIMIT}/sec reached, currently {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}/sec
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger alerts disks which are consuming more than the configured IOPs limit. You can use this to discover systems high high write rates.

trigger_prototype.name: Blockdevice {#BLOCKDEVICE} read limit {$DISK_HIGH_READ_IOPS_LIMIT}/sec reached, currently {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}/sec
trigger_prototype.description: This trigger alerts disks which are consuming more than the configured IOPs limit. You can use this to discover systems high high read rates.

trigger_prototype.name: Filesystem inode usage for {#FSNAME} > {$DISK_USAGE_PERCENT_ALARM}% => {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}
trigger_prototype.description: Partition is running out of inodes. The volume contains to much files. Please increase volume size, delete unnecessary files and inform application owner.

trigger_prototype.name: Filesystem inode WARNING usage for {#FSNAME} > {$DISK_USAGE_PERCENT_WARN}% => {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}
trigger_prototype.description: Partition is running out of inodes. The volume contains to much files. Please increase volume size, delete unnecessary files and inform application owner.

trigger_prototype.name: Filesystem space {#FSNAME} free space < {$DISK_USAGE_ABOVE_1TB_MINFREE_GBYTES}GB ({#FSNAME} > 1TB) => {ITEM.LASTVALUE1} free
trigger_prototype.description:
Partition is running out of space. The volume contains to much data. Please increase volume size, delete unnecessary files or inform application owner.
Filesystem smaller than 1TB are alarmed if the precentage specified by {$DISK_USAGE_PERCENT_ALARM} is reached.
Filesystem greater that 1TB are alarmed if the free space of the partion is lower than {$DISK_USAGE_ABOVE_1TB_MINFREE_GBYTES} gigagbytes.

trigger_prototype.name: Filesystem space {#FSNAME} usage > {$DISK_USAGE_PERCENT_ALARM}% ({#FSNAME} < 1TB) => {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}
trigger_prototype.description:
Partition is running out of space. The volume contains to much data. Please increase volume size, delete unnecessary files or inform application owner.
Filesystem smaller than 1TB are alarmed if the precentage specified by {$DISK_USAGE_PERCENT_ALARM} is reached.
Filesystem greater that 1TB are alarmed if the free space of the partion is lower than {$DISK_USAGE_ABOVE_1TB_MINFREE_GBYTES} gigagbytes.

macro.description: Alert if this amount of read iops is reached
Alert if this amount of write iops is reached
Minimum amount of disk space before alerting, overrides percentage.
Percentage of disk usage to accept before alert
Percentage of disk usage to accept
How many network bfs restransmissions to accept in one cycle
How many network error to accept in one cycle
Maximum offset to accept for ntp sync
Altert if this percentage of memory usage is reached
How many ntp servers should be available before alert
Seconds to wait for agent data
How long to inform about a required reboot

trigger.name: NTP Absolute Time RMS Offset no data

dependency.name: Zabbix Agent Ping no data for {$MONITOR_TIMEOUT} seconds
NTP Absolute Time RMS Offset no data

trigger.expression: ({Custom - OS - Linux:system.cpu.load[,avg5].last(0)}>15 and {Custom - OS - Linux:system.cpu.num.last(0)}<3) or ({Custom - OS - Linux:system.cpu.num.last(0)}>2 and ({Custom - OS - Linux:system.cpu.load[,avg5].last(0)}>{Custom - OS - Linux:system.cpu.num.last(0)}*{$MONITOR_LOAD_WARNING_MULT}))
trigger.name: System Load, {ITEM.LASTVALUE1}
trigger.description: For systems with 1 or 2 CPUs send alerts by a 5-min Load greater 15. For systems with more than 2 CPUS send alerts by a 5-min Load greater than numer_of_cpus*{$MONITOR_LOAD_WARNING_MULT}
